before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"4gth0","text":"Follow this protocol after all terminal experiments have been completed, but before euthanizing the animal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bppu3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i98o","text":"Note: Perfusion with 4% PFA may cause some degree of tissue shrinkage. We observed an average of 3.3% shrinkage with our brain tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1v9rv","text":"Deep brain implant accuracy is important for successful experiments in non-human primates. In this protocol, we describe the steps to use postmortem imaging to assess the accuracy of an implant by visualizing implant location with a small thermal ablation and comparing its coordinates to image based pre-surgical planning.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dhmc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i18q","text":"This protocol is supplementary to the manuscript: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kuv3","text":"Liang, L., Zimmermann Rollin, I., Alikaya, A., Ho, J.C., Santini, T., Bostan, A.C., Schwerdt, H.N., Stauffer, W.R., Ibrahim, T.S., Pirondini, E., Schaeffer, D.J., 2024. An open-source MRI compatible frame for multimodal presurgical mapping in macaque and capuchin monkeys. BioRxiv https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.02.17.580767","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":273,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":281,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F487A49ECD6F49D9AB28A92DB031187D","url":"https://doi.org/10.1101/2024.02.17.580767"}}}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"eeiud","text":"All procedures described in this protocol were approved by the IACUC at the University of Pittsburgh (22091621).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"95tek","text":"Before euthanizing the animal according to protocol, perform a thermal lesion through the deep brain electrode. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8300v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fphr","text":"We use a radiofrequency cannula (S-100 5 mm ActiveTip Straight cannula 22G, Abbott) and a radiofrequency electrode (RF-SE-10 Reusable Stainless Steel Electrode, Abbott), with a radiofrequency generator (NeuroTherm NT 1100).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ur34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49vld","text":"Parameters: ~80℃, 1min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e4hjg","text":"Perfuse transcardially with 1x phosphate buffered saline (PBS), followed by 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5sbi","text":"Dissect out the brain with care. Carefully remove the dura and any blood clots from the surface of the brain.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"tg7l","text":"Remove electrode (not MR compatible) from the brain and euthanize the animal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2hkav","text":"Place the brain in 4% PFA for an additional 24 hours, then, move to 1x PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkmbc","text":"Collect T2 or T2* weighted images of the brain in a 9.4 T/31 cm horizontal-bore Bruker AV3 HD animal\nscanner with the following parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60eqm","text":"T2: 125 μm isotropic,TR/TE = 1500/60ms, FOV = 52×80×56 mm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5v16n","text":"T2*: 80 μm isotropic, TR/TE = 100/16 ms, FOV = 55×70×45 mm","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46rgo","text":"Visualize the images in FSL, and align the anterior commissure to posterior commissure (ACPC) line with the x-axis of the mid sagittal plane with the FLIRT function.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95gkn","text":"Identif y the tip of the electrode (at the center of the thermal lesion) within the internal capsule (or your target of interest), and record the coordinates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":7,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"991hc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2t9p","text":"Calculate the Xi, Yi, and Zi distance (in pixels) from the posterior commissure (PC) point. Convert to metric distance using pixel resolution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":15,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":19,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ade1i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t20m","text":"(coordinate subscript \"i\" indicates implant coordinates, \"t\" indicates target coordinates)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ev906","text":"Calculate target implant error in each axis by subtracting implant coordinates and target coordinates (e.g. Xe = Xi - Xt)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":109,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":114,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":119,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmb5d","text":"Finally, calculate the overall target implant error (IE) using Euclidean distance IE = sqrt(Xe2+Ye2+Ze2) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":93,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":97,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":101,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":94,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":98,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":102,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"12sje","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"","id":0}}}}

title: Assessment of implant accuracy using high-resolution postmortem MRI
title_html: Assessment of implant accuracy using high-resolution postmortem MRI
